com.jgefroh.core
Interface ICore

All Known Implementing Classes:
Core
public interface ICore

The interface for the Core.

Core is the heart of the game.

Core keeps track of all Entities, InfoPacks, and Systems.

It monitors Entities for changes in their composition of Components, and automatically generates appropriate InfoPacks.

It calls methods that perform work in Systems. It also provides accessor methods so that Systems can retrieve the InfoPacks that are relevant to them.

Author:
Joseph Gefroh
See Also:
IEntity, IInfoPack, ISystem, IEntity

Method Detail

addEntity

<T extends IEntity> void addEntity(T entity)
Starts tracking the passed Entity. This should also generate the InfoPacks for the Entity. This should also generate a unique ID for the Entity.

Parameters:
entity - the Entity to begin tracking

addFactory

<T extends IInfoPack> void addFactory(T factory)
Starts using the passed InfoPack to generate infoPacks.

Parameters:
factory - the InfoPack to use to generate more of that type

addSystem

<T extends ISystem> void addSystem(T system)
Starts tracking the passed System as a non-critical system. This should ensure that the System is started.

Parameters:
system - the System to begin tracking

addSystem

<T extends ISystem> void addSystem(T system,
                                   boolean isCritical)
Starts tracking the passed System.

Parameters:
system - the System to begin tracking
isCritical - true if the System should always run, false otherwise;

removeEntity

<T extends IEntity> void removeEntity(IEntity entity)
Stops tracking the passed Entity. This should ensure that the associated InfoPacks are removed.

Parameters:
entity - the Entity to stop tracking

removeEntity

void removeEntity(java.lang.String id)
Stops tracking the Entity with the passed id. This should ensure that the associated {2code InfoPacks} are removed.

Parameters:
id - the ID of the Entity to stop tracking

                                        java.lang.Class<T> type)

Parameters:

type - the Class type of the InfoPack to retrieve
Returns:
the InfoPack of the passed type; returns null if it does not exist

                                        java.lang.Class<T> type)
Gets a specific InfoPack from the Entity with the ID.

Parameters:
id - the unique ID of the Entity to retrieve the pack from
type - the type of InfoPack to retrieve
Returns:
the InfoPack if found; null otherwise

getSystem

<T extends ISystem> T getSystem(java.lang.Class<T> t)
Gets a System that is being tracked by Core.

Parameters:
t - the Class type of the System whose reference to return
Returns:
the System of the desired type returns null if it does not exist

work

void work()
Performs the work in all of the Systems tracked by Core. This should ensure that InfoPacks are valid and generated.

generateInfoPacks

<T extends IEntity> void generateInfoPacks(T entity)
Generates all of the appropriate InfoPacks for the given Entity.

Parameters:
entity - the Entity for whom the InfoPacks are being generated
